Under-20s and Academy|Celtic]] | youthyears2 = 2009–2012 | youthclubs2 = [[Queen's Park F.C.|Queen's Park]] | years1 = 2012–2013 | clubs1 = [[Queen's Park F.C.|Queen's Park]] | caps1 = 34 | goals1 = 2 | years2 = 2013–2014 | clubs2 = [[Dundee United F.C.|Dundee United]] | caps2 = 36 | goals2 = 3 | years3 = 2014–2017 | clubs3 = [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] | caps3 = 99 | goals3 = 3 | years4 = 2017– | clubs4 = [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] | caps4 = 46 | goals4 = 1 <!--Use domestic league appearances only--> | nationalyears1 = 2013–2015 | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalteam1 = [[Scotland national under-21 football team|Scotland U21]] | nationalyears2 = 2014– | nationalcaps2 = 28 | nationalgoals2 = 2 | nationalteam2 = [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] | club-update = 17:15, 9 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = 23:51, 28 November 2018 (UTC) }} '''Andrew Robertson''' (born 11 March 1994) is a Scottish professional [[Association football|footballer]] who plays as a [[left back]] for [[Premier League]] club [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] and captains the [[Scotland national football team|Scotland national team]].
Robertson began his senior career with [[Queen's Park F.C.|Queen's Park]] in 2012 before joining [[Dundee United F.C.|Dundee United]] a year later. His form in his first season as a professional led to him being named [[SPFA Young Player of the Year]] and also making his international debut. He joined [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in July 2014 for a fee of £2.85 million, before joining Liverpool in July 2017 for an undisclosed fee, believed to be an initial £8 million.
Robertson made his full international debut for [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] in May 2014, and he was appointed [[list of Scotland national football team captains|Scotland captain]] in September 2018.
==Early life and career== Robertson was born in [[Glasgow]]. He attended [[St Ninian's High School, Giffnock|St Ninian's High School]] in [[Giffnock]], East Renfrewshire, from 2006 to 2012, where he captained the football team. He also played for Giffnock Soccer Centre and joined [[Celtic F.C.|Celtic]] as a youth, but was released at under-15 level because he was considered to be too small.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/dundee-united-starlet-andy-roberston-2900858|title=Dundee United starlet Andy Roberston: Celtic made a small blunder the day they let me go|work=Daily Record|date=7 December 2013|accessdate=25 July 2014}}</ref> He then signed for [[Queen's Park F.C.|Queen's Park]].
==Club career==
===Queen's Park=== Focusing on his studies, Robertson was on the brink of starting university at undergraduate degree level before he was called up to the Queen's Park first team at the beginning of the [[2012–13 in Scottish football|2012–13 season]]. He made his debut for the club in the [[Scottish Challenge Cup]], in a penalty shoot out win against [[Berwick Rangers]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/19027896 |title=Ramsdens Cup: Berwick Rangers 2–2 Queen's Park (aet, 2–3 pens) |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 July 2012 |accessdate=11 June 2015}}</ref> He went on to make a total of forty appearances during the season,<ref name="Andrew Robertson">{{cite web|url=http://www.dundeeunitedfc.co.uk/index.asp?tm=124&ID=415|title=Andrew Robertson|accessdate=5 August 2013|date=5 August 2013}}{{dead link|date=June 2015}}{{cbignore}}</ref> helping the club to a third-place finish in the [[2012-13 Scottish Third Division|Scottish Third Division]]. His first goal for the club came in a 2–1 defeat to [[East Stirlingshire F.C.|East Stirlingshire]] on 13 November 2012.<ref name="Andrew Robertson"/>
===Dundee United=== Robertson signed for [[Scottish Premiership]] side [[Dundee United F.C.|Dundee United]], along with Queen's Park teammate [[Aidan Connolly]], on 3 June 2013;<ref name="Dundee United sign Robertson and Connolly">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/22762888|title=Dundee Utd sign Queen's Park's Robertson and Connolly|accessdate=5 August 2013|date=3 June 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> he took the squad place of the departing [[Barry Douglas]] who had made the same move three years earlier.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.dundeeunitedfc.co.uk/news/2895/BARRY-DOUGLAS-JOINS-UNITED.html|author=|title= Barry Douglas joins United|work=|date=21 June 2010|publisher= [[Dundee United F.C.]] |accessdate=9 January 2019 }}</ref> Having being ignored in their requests for a transfer fee for Douglas, Queen's Park (an amateur club) protested at the prospect of more players departing to United for nothing and eventually agreed a deal involving a percentage of future transfers, which would later prove beneficial.<ref>{{cite web |url= https://www.heraldscotland.com/sport/13172018.300k-robertson-boost-a-cut-above-for-queens-park/|author=|title= £300k Robertson boost a cut above for Queen's Park|work=The Herald |date=27 July 2014|publisher= |accessdate=9 January 2019 }}</ref>
Robertson immediately became part of manager [[Jackie McNamara]]'s first team plans, making his debut for the club on the opening day of the season in a 0–0 draw with [[Partick Thistle F.C.|Partick Thistle]]. On 22 September 2013, Robertson scored his first goal for Dundee United, in a 2–2 draw against [[Motherwell F.C.|Motherwell]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Dundee United 2–2 Motherwell|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/24098544|publisher=BBC Sport|date=22 September 2013|accessdate=23 September 2013}}</ref> He ran from his own half before sending a low left-foot drive in to the goal from 22 yards.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.scotsman.com/sport/football/latest/dundee-utd-2-2-motherwell-ainsworth-stuns-utd-1-3106278 |title=Dundee Utd 2–2 Motherwell: Ainsworth stuns Utd |newspaper= The Scotsman|date=22 September 2013|accessdate=5 August 2014}}</ref> Soon afterwards he agreed a new contract with United, until May 2016.<ref>{{cite news|title=Dundee secure Robertson extension|url=http://www.dundeeunitedfc.co.uk/index.asp?tm=2&nid=4617&cd=2013|publisher= Dundee United F.C. |date=4 October 2013|accessdate=5 August 2014}}</ref> He was voted [[Scottish Professional Football League monthly awards|SPFL young player of the month]] for September 2013 and player of the month for November 2013.<ref name="pom1113">{{cite news|title=Dundee United defender wins player award|url=http://www.eveningtelegraph.co.uk/sport/dundee-united/dundee-united-defender-wins-player-award-1.162529|work=Evening Telegraph|date=7 December 2013|accessdate=24 November 2014}}</ref> On 12 April 2014, Robertson played in the [[2013–14 Scottish Cup|Scottish Cup]] Semi-final against [[Rangers F.C.|Rangers]] at [[Ibrox Stadium|Ibrox]], which United won 3–1.<ref>{{cite news|title=Rangers 1–3 Dundee United|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/26898652|publisher=BBC Sport|last=Wilson|first=Richard|date=12 April 2014|accessdate=24 April 2014}}</ref> In April 2014, Robertson won the [[PFA Scotland Young Player of the Year]] award<ref name="ypoy14">{{cite news|title=Three Celtic players make player of year shortlist|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27052382|publisher=BBC Sport|date=17 April 2014|accessdate=24 April 2014}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|title=Andrew Robertson: Dundee United defender wins PFA prize|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27183894|publisher=BBC Sport|date=27 April 2014|accessdate=17 May 2014}}</ref> and was also named in the [[PFA Scotland Team of the Year]] for the [[2013–14 Scottish Premiership]].<ref name="toy14">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27080030|title=Celtic and Dundee United trios in SPFL Premiership team of year|date=18 April 2014|accessdate=24 April 2014|publisher=BBC Sport }}</ref>
===Hull City=== [[File: Andy Robertson (19596759769).jpg|thumb|upright|Robertson playing for [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]] in 2015]]
In July 2014, Dundee United accepted an offer of £2.85 million for Robertson from English [[Premier League]] club [[Hull City A.F.C.|Hull City]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/28442322 |title=Andrew Robertson: Dundee United agree fee with Hull City |publisher=BBC Sport |date=24 July 2014 |accessdate=24 July 2014 |first=Jim |last=Spence}}</ref> The transfer was completed on 29 July, as Robertson signed a three-year contract with Hull.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://sport.stv.tv/football/clubs/dundee-united/284200-andrew-robertson-completes-transfer-from-dundee-united-to-hull/ |title=Andrew Robertson completes transfer from Dundee United to Hull|work=STV Sport|date=29 July 2014 |accessdate=20 July 2014}}</ref> He made his competitive debut on the opening day of the season in a 1–0 victory away to [[Queens Park Rangers F.C.|QPR]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.dailymail.co.uk/sport/football/article-2726678/QPR-0-1-Hull-City-Charlie-Austin-rues-penalty-miss-James-Chester-beats-Rio-Ferdinand-ball-head-home-winner.html|title=QPR 0–1 Hull City: Charlie Austin rues penalty miss as James Chester beats Rio Ferdinand to the ball to head home winner|website=Daily Mail|last=Mokbel|first=Sami|date=16 August 2014|accessdate=16 August 2014}}</ref> Robertson quickly settled at Hull and established himself in the side, winning the club's Player of the Month award for August 2014.<ref>{{cite web|last1=Robertson|first1=Neil|title=Andrew Robertson named Hull City's player of the month|url=http://www.thecourier.co.uk/sport/football/dundee-united/andrew-robertson-named-hull-city-s-player-of-the-month-1.581056|publisher=The Courier (Dundee)|accessdate=24 November 2014|date=17 September 2014}}</ref> His first goal for City came on 3 November 2015 away to [[Brentford F.C.|Brentford]] where he opened the scoring in a 2–0 win to put Hull top of the table on goal difference.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34644748|title=Brentford 0–2 Hull|date=3 November 2015|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref> Robertson started the [[2016 Football League play-offs#Championship|2016 Championship Play-off Final]] against [[Sheffield Wednesday]], which Hull won 1–0 to secure promotion to the [[Premier League]].<ref>{{cite news |first=Adam |last=Williams |title=Hull City 1–0 Sheffield Wednesday |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/36348885 |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 May 2016 |accessdate=22 December 2017}}</ref>
===Liverpool=== On 21 July 2017, Robertson signed a long-term deal with [[Liverpool F.C.|Liverpool]] for an initial fee of £8 million.<ref>{{cite news|title=Andrew Robertson: Liverpool sign defender from Hull City for £10m|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/40666486|publisher=BBC Sport|date=21 July 2017|accessdate=21 July 2017}}</ref><ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/269167-liverpool-fc-complete-andy-robertson-signing|title=Liverpool FC complete Andy Robertson signing|date=21 July 2017|publisher=Liverpool FC|accessdate=21 July 2017}}</ref> On 19 August, he made his debut in a 1–0 win over [[Crystal Palace F.C.|Crystal Palace]].<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/andy-robertson-thanks-liverpool-fans-13501385|title=Robertson thanks Liverpool fans after impressing on Reds debut|last=Gorst|first=Paul|date=19 August 2017|work=liverpoolecho|accessdate=31 August 2017}}</ref> Robertson started the 2017–18 season as understudy to [[Alberto Moreno]], but got a run of games when the Spaniard was injured in December. His performance in the 4–3 victory against league leaders [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]] on 14 January earned praise from the Liverpool supporters.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/klopps-patience-key-andy-robertson-14164148|title=Klopp's patience was key for Andy Robertson and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain|last=Jones|first=Paul|date=16 January 2018|work=Liverpool Echo|accessdate=22 January 2018}}</ref> He scored his first goal for the club on the final match day of the 2017–18 season against [[Brighton and Hove Albion | Brighton]] in a 4–0 victory.<ref>{{Cite news|url=https://www.bbc.com/sport/football/44020158|title=Salah breaks record as Liverpool secure top four spot|last=Jennings|first=Patrick|date=13 May 2018|work=|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=13 May 2018}}</ref>
Robertson continued to play regularly for Liverpool during the 2018–19 season.<ref name = "contract"/> He signed a new contract with the club in January 2019, which is due to run until 2024.<ref name = "contract">{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/46911501 |title=Andy Robertson: Liverpool & Scotland defender signs new contract until 2024 |work= |publisher=BBC Sport |date=17 January 2019 |accessdate=18 January 2019}}</ref>
==International career== Robertson was first selected by the [[Scotland national under-21 football team|Scotland under-21 team]] in October 2013.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/24352061|title=Billy Stark names Scotland Under-21 squad for Euro 2015 ties|date=1 October 2013|publisher=BBC Sport}}</ref> He made his debut as a substitute in a 2–1 win against [[Slovakia national under-21 football team|Slovakia]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.uefa.com/under21/season=2015/teams/player=250066157/index.html|title=Under-21 – Andrew Robertson – UEFA}}</ref> Robertson was selected for the under-21 team in November 2015, as the full national team did not have a fixture.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/34701509 |title=Scotland U21s include Andy Robertson for Ukraine match |publisher=BBC Sport |date=2 November 2015 |accessdate=4 November 2015}}</ref>
Robertson was first named in the full [[Scotland national football team|Scotland]] squad for a friendly against [[Poland national football team|Poland]] on 5 March 2014. He came on as a substitute in the second half, as Scotland won 1–0 in Warsaw.<ref name = "poland"/> Scotland manager [[Gordon Strachan]] said afterwards "Andy came on there and the first time he picked it up he drove about 30 yards. I thought 'that's fantastic'. Absolutely no grey area, I'm going to do what I do. I loved seeing that first touch."<ref name = "poland">{{cite news |url=https://www.theguardian.com/football/2014/mar/05/poland-scotland-friendly-international-match-report |title=Scott Brown late show gives Scotland impressive win over Poland in Warsaw |work=The Guardian |date=5 March 2014 |accessdate=24 July 2014}}</ref> Robertson made his first start for the national team in a 2–2 draw with [[Nigeria national football team|Nigeria]] on 28 May 2014.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/27383284 |quote=Scotland's new-look back four, which included Dundee United's Andrew Robertson making his first international start, found themselves under pressure when they conceded possession to Uchebo but Allan McGregor saved the shot. |title=Nigeria 2–2 Scotland |first=Andy |last=Campbell |publisher=BBC Sport |date=28 May 2014 |accessdate=24 July 2014}}</ref>
Robertson scored his first international goal in a friendly against [[England national football team|England]] at [[Celtic Park]] in November 2014, scoring Scotland's only goal as they were beaten 3–1.<ref name = "eng goal">{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/0/football/29999555|title=Scotland 1 – 3 England|date=18 November 2014|publisher=BBC Sport|accessdate=20 November 2014}}</ref>
On 3 September 2018, Robertson was appointed as [[List of Scotland national football team captains|Scotland captain]] by manager [[Alex McLeish]].<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolfc.com/news/first-team/314927-andy-robertson-scotland-captain|title=Andy Robertson appointed new Scotland captain|publisher=Liverpool FC|last=Shaw|first=Chris|date=3 September 2018|accessdate=3 September 2018}}</ref> After a 2–1 defeat against [[Israel national football team|Israel]] in October 2018, Robertson said that both he and fellow left-back [[Kieran Tierney]] were being played out of position in the 3–5–2 system adopted by [[Alex McLeish]] to accommodate both players.<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/45832123 |title=Andy Robertson: Kieran Tierney and I are 'both out of position' |work= |publisher=BBC Sport |date=12 October 2018 |accessdate=13 October 2018}}</ref>
==Personal life== Robertson is engaged to his girlfriend, Rachel Roberts.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/news/showbiz-news/meet-new-everton-livepool-wags-13305301|title=Meet the new Everton and Liverpool WAGS|last=McCoid|first=Sophie|date=4 August 2017|work=Liverpool Echo|accessdate=4 September 2018|quote=...his girlfriend Rachel Roberts is due to give birth to the couple's first child.}}</ref> Roberts gave birth to their son, Rocco, on 26 August 2017.<ref>{{cite news|url=http://www.dailyrecord.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/andy-robertson-reveals-liverpool-icon-11090277|title=Andy Robertson reveals Liverpool icon Kenny Dalglish told him he's got his back|last=McDermott|first=Scott|date=1 September 2017|work=[[Daily Record (Scotland)|Daily Record]]|accessdate=8 September 2017}}</ref> In January 2019 Roberts gave birth to their second child, Aria.<ref>{{cite news|url=https://www.liverpoolecho.co.uk/sport/football/football-news/liverpool-victory-perfect-end-special-15672380|title=Liverpool victory was perfect end to special week for Andy Robertson|last=Pearce|first=James|date=13 January 2019|work=Liverpool Echo|accessdate=22 January 2019}}</ref>
In March 2018, Robertson donated a signed Liverpool shirt of his teammate [[Roberto Firmino]] to a young boy who had given his pocket money to a local [[food bank]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/scotland/43324198 |title=Andrew Robertson gifts Liverpool top to young fan for making foodbank donation |work= |publisher=BBC Sport |date=8 March 2018 |accessdate=9 March 2018}}</ref>
